results.name: default/mysql-bbd8d8757-v8n4g
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/wordpress-7cdb8c4694-xqf4m
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-bbd8d8757-v8n4g], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is missing ready endpoints because the pod mysql-bbd8d8757-v8n4g isn't ready.  
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-bbd8d8757-v8n4g`. 3. Verify readiness probe settings. 4. Ensure pod dependencies are available. 5. Restart pod if needed.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7cdb8c4694-xqf4m], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service has no ready endpoints because the pod is not in a ready state.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Inspect pod details using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-7cdb8c4694-xqf4m`.
3. Look for readiness probe issues.
4. Resolve any errors and ensure the pod is running.
